label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle of linen with solidly massed embroidered round blossoms in red silk, outlined in black, against a ground of green. Yellow centers in flowers. Bordering floral rinceau at top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: embroidered

label: Physical description
value: Medium: Technique: bobbin lace made in Lille style with heavy outlining thread

label: Description
value: Irregular fragment with flanged edge and ornament in relief consisting of quatrefoil and chain motifs surmounting an incised wavy line. Pearly iridescence.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Dr. Walter Leo Hildburgh

label: Description
value: Design showing two angels bearing monstrance; two angles bearing sacred monegram and scrolling leaf frame on which birds perch.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, Technique: bobbin lace, discontinuous tape

label: Description
value: Design shows column with birds, stags and scrolling leaves. Narrow bobbin lace surrounds panel on four sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, discontinuous tape

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: needle lace with ground of loop & twist with twist return

label: Description
value: Perugia towel end with blue bands showing birds, flowers, castles, and the letter M.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft patterning

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 40 x 50 cm (15 3/4 x 19 11/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Part of a sarong showing a white field with narrow blue borders on two sides and wide blue border at end. Borders display blue and white floral pattern and two of the borders are scalloped on the inner side (a North Javanese batik innovation). Ornamented with the "buketan" motif (large-scale pattern of floral bouquets and birds) reflecting foreign influence.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Vertical strip picturing details of Gothic architecture in grisaille, the center containing doorways with figures in green and brown alternating with circular medallions depicting a railroad station with a train and an underpass.

label: Description
value:
Fragment of woven silk with broad blue satin stripes alternating with broad beige stripes with supplementary warp forming elaborate interlacing scrolls in dark brown. Flanked by narrow guard stripes of ivory mini-checkerboard formed by supplementary warps. 
Fragment very irregular in shape as it is remant from upholstery of a sofa and two chairs.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound satin Label: silk compound satin

label: Description
value: Similar wallhanging used in two rooms in Winterthur Museum, Delaware (1955). Has been folded under along top and cut to fit about a ceiling beam. Has been moth-eaten, and perforated with nail holes. Small stylized floral motif set within tracery, printed in green flock and orange pigment, on metallic gold color ground.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Two widths, sewn together, giving in complete repeating pattern of plain and foliate scrolls, with conventional clusters of flowers.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purhcase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Portion of single width, giving incomplete repeating pattern of plain and foliate scrolls, with conventional clusters of flowers. Printed in green wool flock on canvas painted in neutral violet, touched with green and orange.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
Mihrab tile (portion of a Prayer niche)

label: Description
value: Square fragment. Blue, with three planes of raised ornament consisting of Kufic and Neskhi characters and a scrolled stem with fruit, outlined with light reddish brown. Painted over-all pattern of delicate scrolls in pinkish white.

label: Description
value: Four-sided, the lower left corner a right angle. White ground with iridescent olive green decoration consisting of a fragmentary horse and rider and a strapwork border containing conventionalized plant forms.

label: Description
value: Panel of natural colored linen plain cloth painted in polychrome tempera showing two scenes from a series depicting the five senses. At left, figures of a seated man and woman are offered a flower to smell by a putto. At right, a woman playing an organ or dulcimer and a man playing a lute, a figure of a putto singing and reading from a songbook. Inscription above the scene reads "AUDITUS." A vase of flowers separates the two scenes. At bottom, lines from some of Paul Scarron's poems in French and Latin.

label: Description
value: Panel of natural colored linen plain cloth painted in polychrome tempera, showing one of the series of five senses. Figures of a man and woman seated at right, a winged putto offers them a branch of cherries. Above the branch, a banner inscribed "GUSTUS." Below, two monkeys eat fruit. A large beetle and butterfly at left; the edges of a flower arrangement visible at left margin. Very incomplete lines from poems of Scarron in French and Latin at bottom.

label: Description
value: Panel of natural colored linen plain cloth painted in polychrome tempera, showing one of the series of five senses. Figures of a man and woman seated at left. Winged putto at center offers a mirror to the woman, who is combing her hair. A blue and white vase of flowers at right. Verses from Scarron's poems, in French and Latin, at bottom.
The Artist in the Country, from Appletons' Journal of Literature, Science and Art, June 19, 1869, Cover

label: Description
value: Artist with porkpie hat and mustache sits on a camp stool at a portable easel under a white umbrella.  A knapsack in the right foreground is evidence of the overland trek required to reach such a remote site in the White Mountain wilderness.  Well-dressed young lady watches artist at work.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving on white wove paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Deep collar with two rows of flower head halves that form a scalloped egde.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: bobbin lace, blonde style

label: Description
value: Design of a butterfly looked at from above. Four curled feelers on either side of the head and a mask at the end of a long tongue. Solid embroidery on cotton ground in tan, red, blue, brown, green and dark blue. Probably cut from a large mantle.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: embroidered on plain weave foundation

label: Description
value: Figure of a dancer with head bent far backwards. Elaborate headdress. Small mask hangs from chin. Staff in hand. Cotton plain weave cloth solidly embroidered in tan, white, red, black, green, dark and light blue, brown and purple. Possibly once part of a large mantle.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: embroidered in stem stitch on plain weave foundation

label: Description
value: Design of flowers and leaves on curving stem. Lace is attached to brown paper  with hand-made pins.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, paper Technique: bobbin lace, Binche ground

label: Description
value: On the paper is inscription by hand (in ink) the dates 1774 and 1775 and the number 803.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: paper Technique: pricked pattern for 1938-49-1, Binche lace

label: Physical description
value: Medium: parchment Technique: pricked pattern for Binche lace, 1938-49-1

label: Description
value:
Pocketbook of cream-colored silk taffeta embroidered with verse and flowering vine in pink, green and tan silk. Twisted cream-colored silk floss cord around edges; pink silk lining. 
Verse: 
qu’il soit le dépositaire
des sentiments d’un coeur qui sait t’aimer
il n’en est point qui’un ami vueilletaire
il e nest tant qu’il ne peut exprimer

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: embroidered in chain stitches on plain weave Label: silk with silk chain stitch embroidery

label: Description
value: Details of an architectural design printed in black and white: a) portion of an arched opening, with spandrel to left, set with a rocaille cartouche;above, lower portion of draped human figure; b) short channelled column flanked at base by head and shoulders of women; across column, a floral swag; at top, apparent base of spandrel of "a".

label: Description
value: Full width of paper with diagonal squares composed of green lines, with large pseudo-anthemion motifs at points of intersection. Secondary of violet scrolls in vertical meander. Printed in green and violet on ungrounded paper. Formerly used as a book cover.

label: Description
value: Full width printed in four colors: blue, violet, yellow and neutral red, with vine pattern composed of roses, tube-roses, lilac, forget-me-not and camellias, with acanthus and other leaves. Color register marks on right margin; on left margin: "The Camellia" / Sanitary and Washable.

label: Description
value: Full width printed in blue, red and yellow with swags and sprays of flowers. Color register marks on left margin and right margin; stock number 137 on right margin.

label: Description
value: Landscape frieze, with repeating design of mountain lake set with islands. Identical trees in foreground, with one clump of pines, in the distance, appearing larger than others. Entire paper printed with close set lines of square dots, intended to suggest the appearance of tapestry.

label: Description
value: Repeating design of stream with canoes carrying Indians, some carrying rifles, some fishing. Trees form a band in the background. Printed in top selvedge: Antiseptic Pat'd 8-9-04, and Wm. Campbell-Wall-Paper-Co., with color register marks; printed in bottom selevedge: The Oritani, Aegli Desgr, 5015. Printed in greens, red and browns, the trees in "a" largely green, and those in "b" in brown.

label: Dimensions
value: a) NEED DIMS b) Overall: 95.5 x 49.5 cm (37 5/8 x 19 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Children's frieze with repeating group of seven school girls in green and red dresses, holding books, abaci and hoops, with a terrestrial globe. Across bottom a banderole with the Gothic-letter inscription in German: Arbeit macht das Leben Süss [Work Makes Life Sweet]. Printed in top selvedge: Wm. Campbell-Wall-Paper-Co., Antiseptic Pat'd 8-9-04". Printed in bottom selvedge:  "The Froebel, E.J. Walenta, 496".

label: Description
value: Landscape design; repeating clusters of brown semi-leafless trees growing from grassy mounds in foreground, against line of green trees and gold sky. Earth graduates from deep red to pink.

label: Notes
value: Landscape design; repeating clusters of brown semi-leafless trees growing from grassy mounds in foreground, against line of green trees and gold sky. Earth graduates from deep red to pink.

label: Description
value: Frieze shows mounted hunters in red coats, with hound dogs, against a landscape background in which green prevails. Filling shows a landscape without figures. Stamped on each upper margin: Carey Bros. W.P. Mfg. Co., and on frieze: 3248.

label: Description
value: Frieze shows hunters in full course, with hound dogs, against a green landscape background with red foreground. Stamped on upper margin: Carey Bros. W.P. Mfg. Co. 1934. Intended for use in alteration with 1938-50-19.

label: Description
value: Frieze shows mounted hunters in red coats, with hound dogs, against a landscape background, with deep red foreground. Printed in upper margin: Carey Bros. W.P. Mfg. Co." Intended for use in alternation with 1938-50-18.

label: Description
value: Portion of an urn with floral sprays. Printed in green, blue, black and faded pinks. The paper is not white, but a light brown, and has a coarse texture. Formerly used as a book cover.

label: Description
value: Landscape frieze; Flat meadow with hills in far distance; repeating pair of oak trees in foreground. Stamped on upper margin: Gledhill Wall Paper Company. New York, N.Y.; on reverse: Frieze No. 1242 AA/ 30 Inch Ingrains. --WR
